title: Battery - Installation

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Ensure that the battery terminals do not touch the motorcycle frame as this may cause a short circuit or spark, which would ignite battery gases causing a risk of personal injury.
Refit the battery to the battery tray.
The rear battery strap hook has two hook positions, an upper and lower. If an accessory alarm has been fitted, use the upper hook. If no accessory alarm has been fitted, use the lower hook.
Refit the battery cover and secure with the battery strap and USB charger socket. If required, refit the rear light subharness and USB electrical connectors to the cover.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first and tighten the battery terminals to
Apply a light coat of grease to the terminals to prevent corrosion.
Cover the positive terminal with the protective cap.
